Actor 1955-2010 BLP IMDb refimproveJuly 2010Bill Macy(bornWolf Martin Garber; May 18, 1922) is anUnited StatesAmericantelevision, film and stage actor, born inRevere, Massachusetts, to Mollie (ne Friedopfer) and Michael Garber, a manufacturer.cite webhttp://www.filmreference.com/film/93/Bill-Macy.htmlBill Macy Biography (1922-)25 December 2014He was raised inBrooklyn, New York, and worked as a cab driver before pursuing acting.

Macy is best known for playing Walter Findlay, the long-suffering husband of the title character on the 1970stelevisionsituation comedyMaude (TV series)Maude, starringBeatrice Arthur. He also was an original cast member of the long-running theatrical revueOh! Calcutta!He has made more than 70 appearances on film and television, including a memorable role as the co-inventor of the 'Opti-grab' in the 1979Steve MartincomedyThe Jerk, and as the head television writer inMy Favorite Year(1982). His other film credits have included roles inDeath at Love House(1976),The Late Show (film)The Late Show(1976),Serial (1980 film)Serial(1980),Movers & Shakers(1985),Bad Medicine (film)Bad Medicine(1985),Sibling Rivalry (film)Sibling Rivalry(1990),The Doctor (1991 film)The Doctor(1991),Me, Myself and I (film)Me, Myself and I(1992),Analyze This(1999),Surviving Christmas(2004), andThe Holiday(2006).
He appeared in the popular television moviePerry Mason & The Case Of The Murdered Madame(1987) as banker Richard Wilson.

He appeared occasionally onSeinfeldas one of the residents of the Florida retirement community in whichJerry Seinfeld's parents lived. He also appeared on the short-lived sitcomBack to You.cite webhttp://www.imdb.com/name/nm0534409/Bill MacyIMDb25 December 2014He made a guest appearance as a patient onChicago Hopeand as an aging gambler on the seriesLas Vegas (TV series)Las Vegas. In 2006 he made an appearance onMy Name is Earlin the second-season episode, "Van Hickey" as an elderly patient in a nursing home who claims he "once tongue-kissed a Jamaican woman."
